thread.title: There's a gold statue of Kanye West as Jesus in Los Angeles now, and that seems right
thread.title_full: There's a gold statue of Kanye West as Jesus in Los Angeles now, and that seems right

author: Tricia Gilbride
title: There's a gold statue of Kanye West as Jesus in Los Angeles now, and that seems right
text:
Yeezus Christ, there's a gold statue of Kanye West posed as the son of God on the cross in Los Angeles.
West stands on his tip toes in what may or may not be Yeezys upon a pedestal reading "False Idol" — a nod to J Cole's apparent Kanye diss track — looking a lot like an Oscar statue just days ahead of the Academy Awards.
SEE ALSO: Kanye West realizes no one man should have all that power, deletes Trump tweets
"False Idol". #art #streetart #oscars with generous help from @pverik and sculpture @morgothlot #kanyewest #hollywood the statue will be on Hollywood Blvd for some time today. And then at our show Saturday. At Gibson bands 8801 sunset Blvd . The former tower records store.
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 22, 2017 at 10:54am PST
The piece is the work of Plastic Jesus, an anonymous street artist who shared a couple process shots on Instagram.
Just giving this years #oscars statue (a) head. Thanks @pverik and @morgothlot for making this piece come alive! —-#academyawards #statue #lalaland #movies #hollywood #art #streetart #sculpture
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 17, 2017 at 8:04am PST
Oscars statue sneak peak! Not gonna show you anymore. It's gonna be revealed on Wednesday 22nd Feb. Hollywood Blvd. #oscars2016 #oscars #academyawards #jesus #christ #god #religion #gold #statue #streetart #oscars2017
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 13, 2017 at 1:34pm PST
The artist, who has been focusing on anti-Trump artwork lately, so it makes sense that West would be a target following his tumultuous pro-Trump phase.
“Kanye is a genius. He is a brilliant writer and producer, but we’ve built him up to a god-like idol,” Plastic Jesus tells The Hollywood Reporter . “Look at what happened to him at the end of last year when he went into a mental facility suffering from anxiety, stress and, I think, depression.”
Plastic Jesus shared some more insight into the piece on Twitter last week.
pic.twitter.com/I9sbEmb2DZ
— Plastic Jesus (@plasticjesusart) February 17, 2017
Shipped an amazing number of orders. Thanks for your Patience. They are coming out today. #style #fashion #notmypresident #potus #donaldtrump #trump
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 6, 2017 at 9:57am PST
His Oscar statues are an annual thing, providing commentary on Hollywood's ills of the moment.
" BACK-UP PLAN" #oscar2016 Streetart , now installed on Hollywood Blvd . Get there while it's still up #streetart #streetartla #academyawards #hollywood #art
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 25, 2016 at 10:02am PST
La Brea and Hollywood Blvd #oscars2015 #oscars #academyawards #hollywood #streetart #streetartla
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 19, 2015 at 9:54am PST
'Hollywood's best kept secret'... Now situated on Hollywood & La Brea. #philipseymourhoffman #hollywood #heroin #drugs #addiction #oscars2014 #streetart #streetartla
A post shared by Plastic Jesus® - Official (@plasticjesus) on Feb 28, 2014 at 4:07am PST
"False Idol" will be on display this weekend at Gibson Brands Sunset, the former Tower Records building.
